translation: Arjuna said: If Thou thinkest that knowledge is superior to action, O Krishna, why then, O Kesava, doest Thou ask me to engage in this terrible action?
commentary: 3.1 superior? Chet if? of action than action? They by Thee? Much thought? Intelligence: knowledge? Janardana Or Janardana? That then? What why? in action in action? Ghore terrible? Mam me? You engage Thou engage? Kesava O Kesava.Commentary In verses 49? 50 and 51 of chapter II? Lord Krishna has spoken very highly about Buddhi Yoga. He again asks Arjuna to fight. That is why Arjuna is perplexed now.
